summary: The manuscript contains a collection of Ælfric's homilies and saints' lives. It also includes penitential material: three anonymous texts and a translation of Alcuin's De uirtutibus et uitiis, chapters 1-13. Several items have interlineata and marginalia in English, Latin and French.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Ælfric munuc gret æþelƿeard ealdorman eadmod | lice.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'sealde hyre éarpreo | nas eallgildene sona; gildene biagas god herIENDE.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Almost identical to the versions in Claudius B. iv and Laud Misc. 509. However, according to Crawford 1922, Chapters iv, v, xi, xxiii and xxiv offer an independent translation of the Vulgate and vary from the versions in these two manuscripts. Crawford edited these versions in parallel columns (see Crawford 1922, p. 5).

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body:
' Þeos tid fram þisum
and ƿeardum dæge oð ða halgan eastertide is | gecƿeden cristes þroƿungtid.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Sy him lóf and ƿuldor his ormætum eadmodnesse on ealra ƿorulda ƿoruld. amen.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Textually close to CUL Ii. 4. 6; Faustina A. ix and CCCC 302 (See Godden 1979, p. 356). Godden's edition includes lines 1-41, fols 24v-25r/22 and lines 42-65, 74-107, 118-36, 144-72, 176-223 and 237-94, fols 25r2/3-28v/8.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body:
Ego demonium non | sed honorifico patrem | meum
et ues inhonor [] (unclear: trimming).. | me. Ego non quaero [...] (unclear: trimming) | meam est qui quar [...] (unclear: trimming) | et iudicet. amen [...] (unclear: trimming) | dica uobis Si quis se [...] (unclear: trimming) | meu mortem uide [...] (unclear: trimming) | in eternum dixvrunt [...] (unclear: trimming) | daei. Nunc cognouim [...] (unclear: trimming) | demonium habe [...] (unclear: trimming) | Abraham mortu [...] (unclear: trimming) | est et prophete et tu [...] (unclear: trimming) | si quis sermonem meum non [...] (unclear: trimming) | bit in eternum. [Numquid] (unclear: legibility) tu [...] (unclear: trimming) | or es patre nostro Abr [...] (unclear: trimming) | qui [mortuus est:] (unclear: legibility) et prophe [...] (unclear: trimming) | tui sunt Quem te ipsum [...] (unclear: trimming) | respondit Iesus. Si [...] (unclear: trimming) | glorifico me ipsum: [...] (unclear: trimming) | mea nichil est. | Est pater meus qui glor [...] (unclear: trimming) | me; quem uos dici [...] (unclear: trimming) | quia deus [est noster :] (unclear: legibility) et non [...] (unclear: trimming) | uistis eum ego autem n [...] (unclear: trimming) | eum Et si dixero | [non sciu] (unclear: legibility) eum ero simi [...] (unclear: trimming) | uobis mendax Sed sc [...] (unclear: trimming) | et sermonem eius seru [...] (unclear: trimming) | Abraham pater uester e [...] (unclear: trimming) | tauit ut uideret diem [...] (unclear: trimming) | uidit et gauisus [...] (unclear: trimming)

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: Latin

notes.head: Note
notes.body: A quotation from John, 8:49-8:56 copied by Scribe 1 (Traxel's Scribe 4) next to Ælfric's Catholic Homilies, Second Series, XIII, Fifth Sunday in Lent. This passage appears almost verbatim in CUL, Ii. 4. 20: 'The Monastic Breviary-Missal of Ely Cathedral Priory', fol. 82r.

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Scribe 1.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body:
Rubric (initial): VIII kalendas ianuarii. Nativitas Domini Nostri Iesu
Christi.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Ƿe ƿillað to trymminge eoƿres geleafan | eoƿ gereccan þæs hælendes acennednysse be | þære godspellican endeburdnysse.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'þe he for ure lufe gefremode | us to alysednesse. and to ecere blisse. Þam si ƿuldor and lof | mid þam ælmihtigan fæder on annysse þæs halgan | gastes on ealra worulda woruld. Amenn.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Royal 7 C. xii; Vitellius C. v; Cleopatra B. xiii and Lambeth 489; CUL Gg. 3. 28; CCCC 302; CCCC 188; CCCC 178 and CCCC 162; Bodley 343.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: sunu Sƿilche heo oð [[...]] (unclear: trimming) | ne siððan bere [[...]] (unclear: trimming) | ac forði þe crist [[...]] (unclear: trimming) | frumcenned of | manegum gast [[...]] (unclear: trimming) | cum broðrum.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: This marginalia is in fact a correction which was added in the right margin by Scribe 1 to Ælfric's Catholic Homilies, First Series, II, Christmas Day to supply a few lines from the text which were probably omitted at some stage due to eye-skip (See Clemoes 1997, p. 193, ll. 88-90).

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Scribe 1.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Æþeldreþe uirginis

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Ƿe ƿyllad nu aƿriten þeah ðe hit ƿundorlic sy | be ðære halgan æþeldryde þam englisean mæden'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Manega bysna synð | on bocum be sƿilcum, hu oft ƿeras and ƿif ƿundorli | ce drohtnodon. and on clænnysse ƿunodon to ƿuldre | þam hælende. þe ða clænnysse astealde crist ure | drihten. þam is a ƿurðmynt. and ƿuldor on ecnysse. | Amen.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Another copy in Otho B. x (See Skeat 1966, I, p. 551)

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: ƿeall standende geƿorht of marmstun

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: This annotation, which refers to Ælfric's Catholic Homilies, First Series, II, Christmas Day, is in fact a correction by Scribe 1 which was added in the top margin to supply a line from the text which was probably omitted due to eye-skip (cfr. Skeat 1966, p. 436, ll. 80-81).

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Scribe 1.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'XII. kalendas aprellis. Sancti Benedicti Abbatis

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Benedictus se halga abbud on ðisum and | ƿardan dæge geƿat of ðisum deadlican life | to ðam ecan þe he ær deoplice mid hali | gre drohtnunge geearnode'.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'his halga lichama ƿearð þa bebyrged to his sƿus | ter lice scolastican. sƿa sƿa he sylf bebead binnan | iohannes cyrican þæs halgan fulluhteres on'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Bodley 240 and 342, CCCC 198 and 267, CUL Gg. 3. 28. CCCC 198 and CUL Ii. 1. 33 share a common source against Bodley 340 and Bodley 342 (See Godden 1979, p. 354).

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Ends at line 572 of Godden's edition. A folio is missing after fol. 52v.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): VIII. kalendas Marcii. Cathedra Sancti Petri Apostoli.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Ƿe cƿeþað on gerim cræfte cathedra Sancti petri seofan nih | ton ær ðam monðe þe ƿe martius hatað.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'He ge | ƿat ða to heofonum to hælende criste þam is ƿuldor and | ƿurð mynt on ealra ƿorulun (deletion: ) da ƿorold. AMEN.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Junius E. VII and Bodley 343.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Conuersio Sancti Pauli.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Godes gelaðung ƿurðað þysne dæg þam mæran | Paule to ƿyrðmynte.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'ac se bið gesælig. þe his mynegungum | mid gecneordnysse gehyrsumað;'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Other copies: Royal 7 C. xii, Bodley 343; CCCC 303; Bodley 340 and Bodley 342, CCCC 198; Vespasian D. xiv; Vitellius Cv; CUL Gg. 3. 28; CCCC 188; Hatton 116; Hatton 113 and 114; Junius 121; Vitellius D. xvii; The Hague, Koninklijke Bibliothek 133.D.22 and Copenhagen, Rigsarkivet, Aftagne pergamentfragmenter 637-664, 669-71, 674-98

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Text ends at line 122 of Clemoes's edition.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: 'Gif ðu ƿille for þinra synna bereoƿsunge gedon. and andet | nesse þinra scylda. þonne scealt þu sƿa mycel sƿa ðu meaht | mid inreƿeardan heortan. na mid efestlican ƿordan. ac | mid geþencendan mode þas VII. dauiðes psalmis. to dædbote gelomlice | singan : and þu findæst sƿiðe hrædlice godes mildheortnes (addition: ) se ymban | ðe. and þin mod bið mid gastlicere blisse on lihted.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Six lines of texts which were inserted by Scribe 1 in a blank space at the end of Quire 8 (see also Ker 1957, p. 24). This is a translation of the section Primus usus psalmorum of Alcuin's De psalmorum usu liber (see Traxel 2004, p. 27, n. 48). Unique translation from Latin.

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Scribe 1.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: 'Men þa leofestan eoƿer geleafa bið þe trumra gif ge | gehyrað be godes halgum hu hi þæt heofenlice rice ge | earnodon. and be magon þe cuðlicor to heo (addition: ) me clypian gif heo | ra lifes drohtnunga eoƿ þurh lareoƿa bodiunge cuðe | beoð.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: First four lines of the homily only, copied by Scribe 1.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: 'Ƿe ƿyllað eoƿ gereccan þara apostola drohnun | ge. and geendunge PETRUS and PAULUS mid sceortre race. for | þan þe heora þroƿung ys gehƿær on ængliscum gereor | de fallice geendebyrdþus cƿeþende.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: This version survives in Ii. 1. 33 only (Clemoes 1997, p. 388, apparatus).

notes.head: Note
notes.body: The homily starts at line 98 in Clemoes's edition.

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Scribe 1.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): De Passione Apostolorum Petri et Pauli

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'After drihtnes upstige ƿæs petrus bodigen | de geleafan þam leodscipum þe synd gecƿedene. | Galatia. Cappadocia biþinia asia Italia.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Cuð is geond ealle þeodscipas þæt | fela ƿundra gelumpon æt ðæra apostola byrgenum þurh | ðæs hælendes tiðe. þam sy ƿuldor and lof a on ecnysse.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Other copies: Royal 7 C. xii; Bodley 343; CCCC 303; Bodley 340 and Bodley 342, CCCC 198; Vespasian D. xiv; Cotton, Vitellius C. v; CUL Gg. 3. 28; CCCC 188; Hatton 116; Hatton 113 and Hatton 114; Junius 121; Gloucester CL 35; The Hague, Koninklijke Bibliothek 133.D.22 and Copenhagen, Rigsarkivet, Aftagne pergamentfragmenter 637-664, 669-71, 674-98

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Passion only without the beginning; see the two preceding items above.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): II. kalendas decembris passio Sancti Andree Apostoli.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'SE apostol andreas æfter cristes þroƿunge ferde | to ðam lande þe is gehaten achaiga and þær boda | de drihtnes geleafan.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Vton nu biddan þone ælmih | tigan ƿealdend þæt his eadiga apostol ure þingerer | beo sƿa sƿa he ƿunode his gelaðunge bydel. Sy þam metodan drihtne ƿyrðmynt and lof a on | eccnesse. AMEN.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Texts starts at the Passion, as in Vitellius D. xvii. A version is also in Bodley 343.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: Maximilla | ƿas an læfdie | inne þære burh | ofer þa oðre | hlæfdie. heo ƿeorðede sainnt | andreu ˥ com | mid heore cnihte ˥ nam þone halige | licame mid my | cele ƿyrðmunte | ˥ hine smerede mid aromate | Aromat is ge | macad of godes | cynnes ƿeorte | ðe ƿille sƿote | stince hu | hæfde gecore | ænne sƿiðne | fairne stede | on to licgende. | þær hu leide | saintes Andreas | lichame mid | ƿeorðmunte

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: This annotation was inserted by Scribe 1 (Traxel 2004's Scribe 4). It fills the left margin over 24 lines ruled for the purpose of the insertion. Traxel 2004 comments extensively on the passage, suggesting a Latin source from a lost version of the Passio Sancti Andrea Apostoli. He also includes a detailed linguistic analysis of the English version.

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Scribe 1.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: French

notes.head: Note
notes.body: This was inserted by Scribe 1 (Traxel's Scribe 4). It is written on two lines which were ruled for the purpose of the insertion. For comments on possible sources and language, see Traxel 2004, pp. 77-79.

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Scribe 1.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): VI. kalendas Ianuarii Assumptio | Sancti iohanis Apostoli.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'IOHANNES se godspellere cristes | dyrling ƿearð on þysum dæge to heofonan rices myrh | þe þurh godes neosunge genumen.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Þær beoð fela tacna æteoƿde. and untru | me gehælde. and fram eallum frecednyssum alysede | þurh þæs apostoles þingunge. þæs him getiþað | drihten crist þam is ƿuldor and ƿyrðmynt mid fæder | and halgan gaste a butan ende. AMEN.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Other copies: Royal 7 C. xii; Bodley 340 and Bodley 342, CCCC 198; Vitellius C. v; CUL Gg. 3. 28; CCCC 302 and 188; Hatton 116; Hatton 113 and Hatton 114; Junius 121; Harley 2110

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: 'Dominus dicit. Si conuersus fueris et ingemueris; saluus eris. quia deus per prophetam dicit. Non | uult mortem morientis; quantum ut reuertatur a uia sua mala. et uiuet anima eius.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: Latin

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Parts of two biblical verses: Isaiah 30. 15 and Ezekiel 33. 11. According to Traxel (2004), the verses appear in the work of Fulgentius Ruspensis, 'De fide ad Petrum', in Corpus Christianorum, Seria Latina, 91 A, pp. 736-9, ll. 750-822 (Traxel 2004, p. 82).

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Scribe 1. Written on two lines which were ruled for the purpose of the insertion.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'Kalendas mai. Apostolorum philippi et jacobi.'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'PHilippus se godes apostol þe ƿe on þysum dage | ƿurðiað.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'micele ƿel | dæda and ƿundra gelome geleaffullum mannum se þe leo | faða. amen.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Other copies in Bodley 340 and Bodley 342; CCCC 198; CUL Gg. 3. 28; Hatton 113 and Hatton 114 and Junius 121; Vitellius D. xvii (Godden 1979, 361-362)

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'de sancto Iacobo apostolo'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'ǷE ƿurþiað eac on þissere andƿerdan freolstide. | Oþerne apostol iacob þone rihtƿisan.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Vton nu ge broðru biddan geornlice þas halgan | apostolas. þe ƿe todæg ƿurðiað. þæt hi us þingian to urum | scyppende se þe ana rixað on ecnesse god. AMEN.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Other copies in Bodley 340 and Bodley 342; CCCC 198; CUL, Gg. 3. 28; Hatton 113 and Hatton 114 and Junius 121; Vitellius D. xvii (Godden 1979, 361-362)

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): VIII Kalendas Septembris passio Sencti Bartholomei Apostoli

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Ƿyrd ƿriteras secgað þæt þry leodcipas synd gehate | ne India; seo forme India lið to þære silhearƿenarice.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Hwæt | ƿylle ƿe endemenn þyssere ƿerolde gif ƿe for urum | synnum gebrocode beoð buton herian urne drihten | andeadmodlice biddan þæt he us þurh þa hƿilƿendlican sƿingle | to þam ecan gefean gelæde sy him ƿuldor and lof on | ealra ƿorulda ƿorold.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: Gode men gehryrað her þa mihtan þe ure drihten forgeaf Sanct bartholomei þam apostole.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: This is a non-Ælfrician insertion by Scribe 1 (Traxel's Scribe 4), which was originally written in the right margin of the folio and then inserted interlinearly. Although it was erased from the margin, it is still visible.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: untrumnessum aƿurde. et andsƿerede him þurh ða anlicnysse. | þæt hi him lac offrian sceoldan et he hi gehælde. ac he hym | ne heolp mid nanre hæle ac ða þa hi to him bugon þa geswac he | þære lichamlice gedreccednysse forþan þe ahte heora saƿla. þa ƿende | dysige men þæt he hi gehælde þa ða he þære gehælde þa ða he þære gedreccednysse gesƿac Þa | mid þam ðe se | apostol into.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: This passage is Ælfrician and it corresponds to lines 12-18 in Clemoes's edition.

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: This passage was inserted by Scribe 1 after some lines were erased. The writing, however, is not completely contained in the erasure and part of the passage is written in the left margin beyond the central framing line.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'VIII kalendas augusti passio Sancti iacobi apostoli.'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'ON þysum dæge ƿe ƿurþiað on urum | lofsangum and on freolse þone mæran apostol | iacobum.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'and hi sigefæste samod ferdon to criste þam | is ƿuldor and ƿyrðmynt on ealra ƿorulda ƿoruld AMEN'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: First part only as compared to Godden's edition.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'XI. kalendas octobris passio Sancti mathei apostoli et ewangeliste.'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'SE APOSTOL Matheus and godspellere becom þurh | godes sande æfter drihtnes upstige to heofonum to ethiopian | þæt is þæra silhearpena rice'.

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'þær beoð gefremode fela ƿundra gelome | þurh geearnunge þæs eadigan apostoles þurh godes mihte man | num to frofre Sy þæs gode lof a on ecnesse AMEN.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: The text starts at the Passion.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: '.eunuchi.' | [[...]] (unclear: treamming)

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Probably Scribe 1

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'V. kalendas nouembris passio apostolorum Simonis et Iuvis.'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'MEN þa leofostan ƿe ƿyllað eoƿ secgan þæra apostola þro | ƿunge þe ƿe nu todæg ƿurðiað Simones and eudan'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Vton nu biddan þas eadigan apostolas | Simon and iudan. þæt hi us abiddan godes miltronge. se þe leof | að on eaþra ƿorolda ƿorold. AMEN.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: In CUL Gg. 3. 28; Vitellius D. xvii

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'Kalendas ianuarii passio Sancti Thome apostoli.'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'ÆFTER þæs hælendes þroƿunge and æriste of | deaðe and up stige to heofonum þa ða his apostolas to | ferdon geond þysne middan eard Þa becom ihonias | to cesaream byrg'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'and se go | des apostol ƿearð syþþan geferod to syrian lande mid | micelre arƿurðnysse þam ælmihtigan to lofe Se ðe | on ecnesse rixað riclice mihtig. AMEN;'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: The text starts without the Latin introduction (see Hill 1997, p. 420). The introduction is included in Julius E. vii and Caligula A. xiv.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'VII Kalendas mai passio Sancti marci ewangeliste.'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'MARCVS se godspellere be godes dihte gefer to | egipta lande and þær lærde þæt folc'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Ƿe ge | endiað þus þas gesetnysse HER.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Julius E. vi, CCCC 198 and Vitellius D. xvii.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Incipit sermo de memoria Sanctorum

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'EGo sum alfha eto. initium et finis dicit dominis qui est | et qui erat et qui uenturus est omnipotens. Þæt is on en | glisc '

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'and habban | us on ende þone ecan ƿurþmynt a mid gode sylfum gif | ƿe sƿincað nu her þær to us gefultumige se ðe leofað | and rixað a buton ende AMEN.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Julius E. vi; CCCC 303.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: ¶ li uilan dit en repruuier; de iueune seint uiel auersier. | pur ceo dit li uilain uerite; Tels l unt ki ne ten seuent gre. | qu entre l aueir e le bricun; ne sunt pas longes cumpaignun. | li uilains dit la u il ueolt Que oil ne ueit a cuer ne duelt.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: French

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Four proverbs about 'the peasant', found in the Old French metrical Life of St Giles by Guillaume de Berneville (Traxel 2004, p. 106, n. 304 in particular).

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: This passage was inserted by Scribe 1 (Traxel's Scribe 4).

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'VII. kalendas ianuari passio Sancti Stephani prothomartyris.'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Ƿe rædað on þære boc | þe is gehaten actus apostolorum þæt þa apostolas gehadodon seofon | diaconas on þære gelaðunge'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'nu todæg | hi underfengon stephanum blissiende on heora geferædene | mid þam he ƿuldrað and blissað. a on ecnesse AMEN.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: This item was extensively corrected in a twelfth-century hand with interlinear annotations; probably Scribe 1.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: 'Vbi te inuenero. Ibi te iudicabo.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: Latin

notes.head: Note
notes.body: This annotation is probably copied by Scribe 1 and it is not found in the Bible, but it is an agraphon, which was attributed either to Jesus or Ezekiel, and it is well-known and established in Greek and Latin preaching texts. For instance in Bernard of Clairveaux, Sententia, III 74, there is an identical quotation: 'Ubi te inuenero, ibi te iudico'. A thorough historical survey of this agraphon appears in Dolbeau 2003.

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Scribe 1.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'V. kalendas ianuari Natale Innocentium.'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'NV todæg godes gelaþung geond ealne | ymbhƿyrft mærsað þæra eadigra cildra freolstide.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Se þe leofað and rixað a butan ende. AMEN

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: This item was extensively corrected in a twelfth-century hand with interlinear annotations; probably Scribe 1.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: [...] (unclear: unreadable) æfe man sceal herian þone dæg

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Probably inserted by Scribe 1

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Scribe 1.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'XI kalendas febrari. passio Sancti uincentii martiris'.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'ON ispanian lande þære | speoniscan leode. ƿæs se halga martir þe hatte | uincentius to menn geboren.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'and mid mycelre lufe hi man | ƿyrðaþ gehƿær sƿa sƿa us secgað bec for his soðan gelea | fan þam hælende to lofe þe leofað a on ecnesse amen

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Bodley 343. This item was extensively corrected in a twelfth-century hand with interlinear annotations, probably by Scribe 1.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'IIII Uus avgustis passio beati Laurentii martiris'.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'ON Decies dæge þæs ƿælhreoƿan caseres ƿæs se halga | bisceop sixtus on romana byrig drohtniende.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'for þæs naman he þroƿaðe mid cenum mode menigfealde tin | tregu mid þam he orsorlice on ecnesse ƿuldrað. amen.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Royal 7 C. xii, Bodley 343, CCCC 303, CCCC 198, CUL Gg. 3. 28, Vitellius C. v, CCCC 188, Hatton 116, The Hague, Koninklijke Bibliothek 133.D.22 and Copenhagen, Rigsarkivet, Aftagne pergamentfragmenter 637-664, 669-71, 674-98, Otho A. xviii, Vitellius D. xvii.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): IIII Idus martii Sancti Gregorii pape uibis romane inclitus.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Gregorius se halga papa englisere ðeode apostol | onƿisum andƿerdan dæge after menigfealdum gedeorufum | and halgum gecnyrdnyssum'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'and syððan on ðysum dæge geƿat to þam ecan setle heofenan | rices on þam he leofað mid gode ælmihtigum a on ecnesse AMEN'.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: In Bodley 340 and Bodley 342; CCCC 198; CUL Gg. 3. 28; Vitellius D. xvii.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'VIII Kalendas mai. passio Sancti Georgii martiris'.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Gedƿolmenn | aƿriton gedƿyld on heora bocum be þam halgan ƿere | þe is gehaten Georius'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'And se halga georivs siðode to | criste mid þam he a ƿunað on ƿuldre. AMEN.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Julius E. viii.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'X Kalendas iulii. passio Sancti Albani martiris.'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Sum hæþen casere ƿæs gehaten | dioclicianus se ƿæs to casere gecoren'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Sy ƿuldor | and lof þam ƿelƿillenðan scyppende. seðe ure fæderas feon | dum ætbræd and to fulluhte gebigde þurh his bydelas. amen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Julius E. viii.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'IS nu eac to ƿitenne þæt man ƿitnað for | oft þa arleasau sceaðan and þa sƿicolan þeofas.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'on þam is ece ƿuldor on ealra ƿorolda ƿorold amen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Julius E. viii; Junius 23; CCCC 303

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body:
Rubric (initial): 'XII Kalendas Decembres. Passio Sancti eadmundi Regis
et martiris'.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'EAdmund ðe eadiga eastengla Kyning ƿæs. | snoter and ƿurðfull and ƿurðode symle mid æðe | lum þeaƿum ðonne'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Þæs him sy | ƿuldor a mid his heofonlice fæder and þam halgan gaste AMEN.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Without Preface. Other copies in Otho B. x; Vitellius D. xvii and Bodley 343.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Vir erat in terra hus : nomine Iob. Et erat uir ille sim | plex et rectus ac timns deum et recedens a malo bi þam eadige iobe

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Mine gebroðra ƿe rædað nu æt godes þenungum be þam | eadigan ƿere iob'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Sy ƿuldor and ƿyrðmynt þam ƿel ƿillendan scyp | pende ealra his ƿundra and his ƿel dæda. Se ðe ana | is god a on ecnusse AMEN '

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Bodley 343; Vespasian D. xiv and CUL Gg. 3. 28.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): NONI AUGUSTI. Passio Sancti osƿald

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Æfter þam þe Agustinus Regis and martiris. | to engla lande be com ƿæs sum Kyning Osƿald | gehaten on norðhumbrja lande'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Sy þæs ƿuldor þam ælmihtigan gode | a to ƿorolde ƿorld'.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Other copies in Vitellius D. vii and Julius E. vii

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): VII. idus octobri. passio Sancti Dionisii sociorum eius

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Pavlus þeoda lareoƿ þaða he | geond land ferde bodigende geleafan | sƿa sƿa him bebead þe hælend '

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'to lofe þam ælmihtigum þe leofað a | on ecnesse AMEN.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Another copy in Julius E. vii

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'VIII Kalendas decembris. passio Sancti Clementis martiris.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Men þa leofostan eoƿer geleafa byð þe trum | ra gif ge gehyrað be godes halgum hu hi þæt | hefonlice rice geearnodon.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'se ðe his halgan mid tacnum | and ƿundrum geƿurðad and sƿa heora geearnunga ge | sƿuteliað. Sy him ƿuldor and ƿurðmynt a to ƿorolde AMEN.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: As compared with Clemoes' edition lines 34-50 and 148-280 are not present in this item. The explicit re-works the ending in an unique version.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'De Falsis Diis'

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: Incipit (Latin): ''O fratres dilectissimi diuina scriptura | cultum unius ueri dei'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Eft þa ða ðe tima com on theodosies dagum | þæs æðelan caseres þe ealle het to brecan þa'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Some lines not present as compared with Pope's edition, and end missing due to loss of leaves. Another version in CCCC 178.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: ' here samod mid sƿyðlicre bylde and þær ƿurdon ofsla | gene eahta hund ƿera'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Sy ƿuldor and lof | þam ƿel ƿillendan gode a on ecnyss ƿe cƿeðað Amen

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Acephalus, due to loss of leaves; in Julius E. vii; CCCC 303 and 198, and Vitellius D. xvii

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Is sƿa þeah to ƿitenne þæt on þyssere ƿorolde synd þreo | endebyrdnyssa on annysse gesette þæt synd Laboratores | Oratores Bellatores '

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'and hi mid gode nu lybb (addition: ) að forðan ðe hi furðon noldon | ænne fugol acƿellan:-

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: In Julius E. vii; CCCC 178, CCCC 303 and CUL 198.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): 'II Kalendas Augusti passio Sanctorum Abbon and Sennem.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'ON Decies dagum þæs deoflican | Kaseres ƿæron tƿegen cyningas on crist ge | lofede. Abdon and Sennes'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'þam hælende to lofe þe lyfað a on ecnysse':-

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Julius E.vii.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Epistola pauli

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Pavlus ðe apostol ealra þeoda | lareoƿ manode þa cristenan þe he sylf ær to ge | leafan gebigde on anum pistole.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'sy him ƿuldor and lof a to ƿorulde. amen.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English.

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: CCCC 303 and CCCC 302.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): Exal | tatio Sancte Crvcis.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Ƿe ƿurðiað mid lofsangum | for ures geleafan trymminge tƿegen dagas | on geare drihtne to ƿurdimynte for ðære halgan | rode syðan heo afunden ƿæs.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Sy ƿuldor | and lof ðam ƿellendan gode þe ðe æfre rixað | on ecnysse AMEN;'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: In Vitellius D. xvii.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Mage ƿe gyt her gehyran in. eoƿre saƿle | þearfe gif ge me hlystan ƿyllað.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'þam sy ar and ƿurðmunt and miht and ƿuldor and anƿeald | æfre butan ælcum ende AMEN

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Another version in Junius 85.

notes.head: Rubric
notes.body: Rubric (initial): De Scientia.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Ærest ealra þinga gehƿilcum men is to secenne.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'and þæt ƿe moton | mid him ƿunian þær he lifað and rixað on ealra ƿorul | de ƿoruld a butan ende AMEN.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: The explicit differs from Assmann's edition, as the text finishes at line 386. This edition is based on Vespasian D. xiv.

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Scribe 1.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Ne beode ƿe nanum mannum nane niƿe bebodu.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'Sy | him lof and ƿuldor a on ecnesse. AMEN.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Scragg 1979 notes that this is 'a unique composite homily which opens with a sentence from the end of Vercelli xix and concludes with part of the Canons of Edgar' (p. 257). Edited lines of this homily appear in Fowler who edits lines from 221v/22 to 222r/13. His edition is based on eleventh-century manuscripts: Brussels, Bibliothèque Royale 8558-62 (2498), CCCC 265 and CCCC 201, Tiberius A. iii, Claudius A. iii, CUL Add. 3206, Junius 121, Laud Misc. 482 (Fowler 1965, pp. 1-3).

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Her ƿas drihthelm sum æþele þegen on norðhumbra | lande on æfnunge of þissum life gelead and his lic leag ealle | þa niht inne besett.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'þa hine mon geaxode hu he mihte þonne myclan cyle sƿa for beƿan. | he andƿyrde and cƿoth Sciðran and ƿyrsan hic (addition: ) e geseah Sƿa he hit ma | code on his life and manega oðre he gerihtleahte mid ƿorde | ge mid bysnonge to rihtan geleafan. Gerihtlæce us drihten | hælend crist þurh þinran myclan mil (addition: ) dheortnesse sƿa sƿa | þin ƿilla sy amen.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Incipit and explicit differ as compared with Godden's edition, starting in the middle of line 7 and finishing at line 111. The Homily is found in Bodley 340 and Bodley 342; Hatton 115; Vespasian D. xiv and CUL Gg. 3.28 (Godden 1979, pp. 367-68).

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: 'Syle ece gode æhta þinra þone teoðan dæl he getyþað þe.'

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: 'ac he geƿent heora mod onsa | rgnysse forþanðe hi þæt yfel on ƿeorulda gesecen þæt hi mid | þæs yfelan under gytenysse magon beon on geanƿende to | drihtne gehƿorfe Ne.

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Unique

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: 'Se þisa Salomon cƿoth. Þæt selre ƿære to ƿunienne mid leon and mid draca; (addition: ) þonne mid yfelum ƿife and oferspæcum spræcum.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Sentence from First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Decollation of St John the Baptist.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Annotation by Scribe 1 (Traxel 2004, p. 120). Swan compares the purpose of this annotation to those in Faustina A. x, suggesting that they 'increase the range of reference of the main text' (Swan 2000, p. 80)

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Scribe 1.

notes.head: Addition
notes.body: 'Se ƿisa eft cƿæth.Þæt nan ƿild deor ne on feoƿer fotum. ne on creopendum nis to ƿið | metenne yfelum ƿife.'

notes.head: Text Language
notes.body: English

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Sentence from Ælfric, First Series of Homilies [Catholic Homilies I]: Decollation of St John the Baptist.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: Annotation carried out either by Scribe 4 or Scribe 1 (Traxel 2004, p. 120). Swan compares the purpose of this annotation to those in Faustina A. x, suggesting that they 'increase the range of reference of the main text' (Swan 2000, p. 80)

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: Scribe 1.

notes.head: Layout type:
notes.body: Layout type: LO1

notes.head: Columns:
notes.body: Columns: 1

notes.head: Written Lines:
notes.body: Written Lines: 24

notes.head: Locus:
notes.body: Locus: Quires 1-3: fols 2r-25v; Quire 7: 47v, 48r; Quire 8: 55r, 56r-60v; Quire 9-11; 12 (fol. 87v has the double pricking on the left inside, but no double binding line), 13-14, 16, 28: fol. 223

notes.head: Dimensions:
notes.body: Dimensions: 175 mm x 110 mm / 103 mm; ruled

notes.head: Overview:
notes.body: Overview: Ruling in pencil and/or crayon on both sides. Double bounding lines on both sides of the frame, ca. 50 mm apart. The lines are guided by two small pricks at the top and bottom on the left and right of the folio. Small pricks appear on the external margin ca. 80 mm apart to guide line ruling still visible. The writing is above the line, but the number of lines varies from 21 to 24. See diagram.

notes.head: Layout type:
notes.body: Layout type: LO2

notes.head: Columns:
notes.body: Columns: 1

notes.head: Written Lines:
notes.body: Written Lines: 26

notes.head: Locus:
notes.body: Locus: Quires 4: fols 26r and 28v (with 29 lines)

notes.head: Dimensions:
notes.body: Dimensions: 175 mm - 180 mm x 115 mm - 120 mm; ruled

notes.head: Overview:
notes.body: Overview: Ruling in pencil. Double bounding lines on the left ca. 60 mm apart, and single on the right side of the frame. Lines are guided by small pricks at the top and bottom on the left and right of the folio. Small pricks appear on external margin 70 mm apart to guide line ruling still visible. Fols 26v and 27r have the symmetry reverted the single line on the left side of the frame and the double on the right. See diagram.

notes.head: Layout type:
notes.body: Layout type: LO3

notes.head: Columns:
notes.body: Columns: 1

notes.head: Written Lines:
notes.body: Written Lines: 24

notes.head: Locus:
notes.body: Locus: Quires 5: fols 29-36v; 17, 18, 19, 20, 21; Quires 7: fol. 52v; 16: fols 122v-126v (These folios are pricked for two double binding lines at both sides of the frame, but the ruling is single); 22, 23, 24, 25, 26, 27, 28: fols. 218r-222r, 225-227v

notes.head: Dimensions:
notes.body: Dimensions: 170 mm x 116 mm / 110mm; ruled

notes.head: Overview:
notes.body: Overview: Ruling in pencil. Single bounding line on both sides of the frame. Lines are guided by small pricks at the top and bottom on the left and right of the folio. Small pricks appear on both side of the page, 70 mm apart to guide line ruling still visible. The number of ruled lines per page can vary between 24 and 25. See diagram.

notes.head: Layout type:
notes.body: Layout type: LO4

notes.head: Columns:
notes.body: Columns: 1

notes.head: Written Lines:
notes.body: Written Lines: 21

notes.head: Locus:
notes.body: Locus: Quires 6: fols 37r-39r; 43r, 44v; Quire 7: 47v, 48r

notes.head: Dimensions:
notes.body: Dimensions: 163 mm x 120 mm; ruled

notes.head: Overview:
notes.body: Overview: Ruling in pencil. Double bounding lines on the right and left side of the frame, ca. 70 mm apart. Lines are guided by small pricks at the top and bottom on the left and right of the folio. Small pricks appear on external margin 90 mm apart to guide line ruling still visible. See diagram.

notes.head: Layout type:
notes.body: Layout type: LO5

notes.head: Columns:
notes.body: Columns: 1

notes.head: Written Lines:
notes.body: Written Lines: 21

notes.head: Locus:
notes.body: Locus: Quires 6: fols 39v-42v, 43v, 44r; 7: fols 45r-47v, 49r, 50r, 51r, 52r, 52v

notes.head: Dimensions:
notes.body: Dimensions: 160 mm x 110 mm; ruled

notes.head: Overview:
notes.body: Overview: Ruling in pencil. Double bounding lines 6 mm a part on left side of the frame, single on the right. Lines are guided by small pricks at the top and bottom on the left and right of the folio. Small pricks appear on external margin 90 mm apart to guide line ruling still visible. See diagram.

notes.head: Layout type:
notes.body: Layout type: LO6

notes.head: Columns:
notes.body: Columns: 1

notes.head: Written Lines:
notes.body: Written Lines: 22

notes.head: Locus:
notes.body: Locus: Quires 15, 16: fols 119-122r (fol. 120r includes the pricking for a double binding line on the right, but there is no ruling).

notes.head: Dimensions:
notes.body: Dimensions: 170 mm x 110 mm / 150 mm; ruled

notes.head: Overview:
notes.body: Overview: Ruling in pencil. Double bounding lines on one side of the frame, single on the other. As a rule the double bounding line is on the outside of the verso and the recto, the single on the inside when the page is opened. Small pricks appear on external margin 70 mm apart to guide line ruling still visible. Number of ruled lines can vary up to 24 per page. See diagram.

binding: Bound, s. xvii in brown suede.
accompanying: Added flyleaves of a printed edition of a Latin text at the beginning and the end of the manuscript.

history.origin: Treharne suggests a South-Eastern origin, probably Christ Church, Canterbury or Rochester (Treharne 1998, pp. 240-44). Schipper argues that part of the manuscript was copied in the cathedral-priory of St Æthelthryth and St Peter in Ely. This argument is based on the presence, in the manuscript, of this homily, which could have constituted the central starting point for the process of copying (Schipper 1983, pp. 291-92). Traxel does not offer a conclusive argument on the history of the manuscript. However, he suggests a possible compilation originally from St Augustine's Canterbury and then Ely (Traxel 2004, p. 207). Richards’ review of Traxel re-proposes a possible Rochester provenance (Richards 2007). Frankis 2007 proposes a connection with the priory of Barnwell, an house of Augustinian canons which was dedicated to St Giles.
history.provenance: It is possible that the manuscript was at Ely in virtue of the evidence on fol. 25r. The manuscript was amongst the collection of Matthew Parker (James 1912, p. xxxvii, n. 17, see also Ker 1957, p. 23). It is not clear how the manuscript came into the possession of Parker. However, it may be possible that he found Ii. 1. 33 at Ely during his residence there. On 10 September 1541, Ely was re-founded with a new chapter, a dean and eight canons ('Ely Introduction') and Parker was 'among the first canons of the new foundation'. Other manuscripts now in Corpus Christi College Cambridge came into Parker's possession while he was at Ely (CCCC 44, 335, 393 and 416, see Owen 1973, p. 4).
history.acquisition: Donated to Cambridge University Library in 1574 by Matthew Parker together with other manuscripts containing Old English texts: Ii. 24; Ii. 2. 11; Ii. 4. 6; Kk. 3. 18 and Hh. 1. 10. At a similar time Parker gave also Ff. 1. 23 and Gg. 3. 28 (Oates 1986, pp. 97-101). Possibly under the influence of Andrew Perne, master of Peterhouse in 1554 and dean of Ely in 1557, who was restoring the University Library in 1574 (see also, Wright 1949-53, p. 224).

admin: Manuscript described and encoded by Orietta Da Rold, with suggestions by Elaine Treharne, Mary Swan and Oliver Traxel, edited by Takako Kato and Hollie Morgan (2010; 2013). The author thanks Oliver Traxel for sharing his material with her, and Michael Gullick for his suggestions.
